intro: Lobularia lagascae, commonly known as the Canary Island white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting to the harsh, arid conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Lobularia lagascae is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
